creator: apache-issues@harkless.org
text:
There does not appear to be any documentation of how to interpret what appears
in the log when using the %u log format string.  Besides the possibilities of
"-" and "<username>", there are "auth:<username>" and "no-auth:<username>" and
possibly others which deserve explanation.  (I couldn't find any further
information on %u via Googling or in my copy of "Apache: The Definitive Guide",
either.)

I don't see anywhere in the httpd source that no-auth is prepended to r->user, including in 
mod_log_config.c or any of the core authentication modules.

Please reopen this if it's still valid, and point out where this string is added.

Cheers.
creator: noodl@apache.org
apache-issues@harkless.org
text:
Argh.  Sorry.  My mistake.  I didn't realize our old developers had put in some
custom stuff for the logging to get the "auth:" and "no-auth:".  No wonder I
couldn't find documentation on it.  Sorry again for wasting your time.
